commit_message:
Support VM memory encryption using Intel's MKTME

This specification proposes the launch of VM instance with its memory
encrypted on Intel's MKTME capable compute host with libvirt support.
This specification also proposes changes needed in image metadata
properties and flavor extra specs to configure encryption policy.
This policy information is used by Libvirt to boot the instance
with memory encryption type(AMD-SEV, Intel-MKTME) available
on the compute host.

Change-Id: I0cc94e28afb9279a4bc43c365248616d77ea40de
Implements: blueprint intel-mktme-libvirt-support

commit_message:
refactor: service group names

The uwsgi role assumes that the keys used match the service names
and all of our other services follow this pattern so let's keep
it the same for this.

Change-Id: Id740ff6704bddad306f7470665717dd5c8674e82

commit_message:
Moves container log collection to standalone script

Moves huge in-line shell script into standalone file, which makes it much easier
to lint, test and maintain.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705347/
Change-Id: I17cbe9fb95897557b159db8a215875f446c89843

commit_message:
Add support to run Container Puppet tasks without Paunch

Deploy the container-puppet-* containers with tripleo-container-manage
instead of container-puppet.py which uses Paunch.

This is the last piece where Paunch isn't used anymore in the
deployment.

Change-Id: I6fdf03a639ca63047fdd6ef603f549781a06d07b

subject: Skip database contact when paused
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-21 07:30:10.000000000', 'message': 'Skip database contact when paused

During database maintenace, such as series upgrade, clients are paused.
However, when the database units come back after being paused they trigger
a db changed hook on the clients. This is unfortunante as the first time
this happens the DB is unavailable. So do not attempt to contact the DB
whilst paused.

Change-Id: Ib4e97cc44a7cf94005b7e52c6316ec4bc3a1601f
'}]
commit_message:
Skip database contact when paused

During database maintenace, such as series upgrade, clients are paused.
However, when the database units come back after being paused they trigger
a db changed hook on the clients. This is unfortunante as the first time
this happens the DB is unavailable. So do not attempt to contact the DB
whilst paused.

Change-Id: Ib4e97cc44a7cf94005b7e52c6316ec4bc3a1601f

commit_message:
Add service management support.

The current role for backup and restore will need service
management to insure that all running services on the nodes
are stopped and restarted in order to capture a consistent state.
This change also includes database dump functionality which will
allow the operator to create a clean backup of the database.

Change-Id: Ic75f40a750880be4ea00ed79de4575cdbbe0f190
(cherry picked from commit 9b26f440d3ca163ed97d2ec3dc87ca96b2745d9c)

commit_message:
Add manila CI

This patch aims to fix and cleaup manila role and add CI into it.

Changes it implements:
* Fix endpoint creation
* adds playbook.yml in examples to use integrated linters check
* adds role CI tests using integrated repo
* adds sqlite installation

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/704163

commit_message:
Use internal API endpoints in overcloud API interaction

Connections default to 'public' interface when attempting to run
openstack commands.  This breaks setups where the network hosts are
separate from the controllers.

This change adds an ``openstack_interface`` variable to select the
correct endpoint to use, which defaults to ``internal``.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Senizaiz <michael@r-hpc.com>

Change-Id: Ifa766d2cc3ed7077f03c571398072ad5117701c6
Story: 2006814
Task: 37374
(cherry picked from commit 84d17b055eda257395aa5fd38487382d1ac2105a)

Be more specific about python binary to use

Since python3 may be used as default bython and symlinked to
/usr/bin/python we should be more specific about what python to use.

Change-Id: I293c4e0bb6d7ede80c3f879f26fa005f75f2c33a

  - avoid setting gnocchi publishers by default

commit_message:
Gate running methods that need Vault backend on db

Gate running methods that need vault svc on db being available
as vault service will not be operational if the db is not present.
This is particularly important when the db is unavailable for
series upgrade.

Closes-Bug: 1862616
Change-Id: Iebea7d592b3e0520fbc095223e73bd1c960b4a05

client.get_client. Switch to using get_client.

commit_message:
Provide a clear error message when using client.Client without a session

Currently we fail with _construct_http_client() takes at least 1 argument.
This change provides a proper TypeError and updates documentation to make
it clear where a session is required. Also provided are explicit unit
tests on passing a session via various means.

Change-Id: I96073dc80d225a9b88fdc12bb058c0145aca623b
(cherry picked from commit e8914a7ef9eb582441a7067f2663e19209f32822)

commit_message:
'Independent' PowerVM items no longer released

nova-powervm and networking-powervm used to be released as independent
deliverables, but they switched to being cycle-tied in Rocky. Now they
are handled by a SIG. Let's mark them as end-of-life in the independent
deliverables list on releases.o.o.

Change-Id: I7a848227b5e0955a3265b0e9b588014802749574

subject: No longer release-manage doc deliverables
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 11:33:49.000000000', 'message': 'No longer release-manage doc deliverables

Upon completion of the decentralization of doc production, the Docs
team became a SIG. Its two remaining deliverables (openstack-manuals and
training-labs) were managed by the release team (as are all project
teams deliverables) which mostly amounted to branch creation.

Now that those are managed by a SIG, they no longer need to be managed
by the release team and can handle branch management as needed.

Change-Id: Ic5d97200fe35e1a7e9c29065e77231ddec0e286a
'}]
commit_message:
No longer release-manage doc deliverables

Upon completion of the decentralization of doc production, the Docs
team became a SIG. Its two remaining deliverables (openstack-manuals and
training-labs) were managed by the release team (as are all project
teams deliverables) which mostly amounted to branch creation.

Now that those are managed by a SIG, they no longer need to be managed
by the release team and can handle branch management as needed.

Change-Id: Ic5d97200fe35e1a7e9c29065e77231ddec0e286a

subject: Remove files for non-OpenStack deliverables
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 11:28:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove files for non-OpenStack deliverables

bandit and doc8 have migrated to GitHub and have releases there.
Listing older releases here is confusing at best, so let's remove
them, especially as arguably they were never part of the "release".

sqlalchemy-migrate is not under OpenStack governance, so arguably
should never have been listed here. The ACL allows its core team
to tag releases directly without going through openstack/releases.

fairy-slipper has long been abandoned, and has arguably never been part
of the "release", so let's remove it.

Change-Id: I525a984a9406ea695bb815435ae7db4f8583f0af
'}]
commit_message:
Remove files for non-OpenStack deliverables

bandit and doc8 have migrated to GitHub and have releases there.
Listing older releases here is confusing at best, so let's remove
them, especially as arguably they were never part of the "release".

sqlalchemy-migrate is not under OpenStack governance, so arguably
should never have been listed here. The ACL allows its core team
to tag releases directly without going through openstack/releases.

fairy-slipper has long been abandoned, and has arguably never been part
of the "release", so let's remove it.

Change-Id: I525a984a9406ea695bb815435ae7db4f8583f0af

subject: networking-calico is no longer release-managed
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 12:44:35.000000000', 'message': 'networking-calico is no longer release-managed

Networking-calico appears in the "independent" deliverables making up
OpenStack release. However it's been out of OpenStack governance and
released separately since 1.3.1.

Marking it "abandoned" would be factually incorrect since it's still
released regularly (3.12.0 was released last month) so I think the best
option is to remove its deliverable file altogether, considering it's
only been briefly considered a part of openstack release.

Change-Id: Id1846cae2236b1451abd3aaeb2a4a9a6a8c705ba
'}]
commit_message:
networking-calico is no longer release-managed

Networking-calico appears in the "independent" deliverables making up
OpenStack release. However it's been out of OpenStack governance and
released separately since 1.3.1.

Marking it "abandoned" would be factually incorrect since it's still
released regularly (3.12.0 was released last month) so I think the best
option is to remove its deliverable file altogether, considering it's
only been briefly considered a part of openstack release.

Change-Id: Id1846cae2236b1451abd3aaeb2a4a9a6a8c705ba

dragonflow, gnocchi and networking-onos used to be released under a

governance anymore, and development seems to have stopped. Mark them

commit_message:
No more releases from non-OpenStack projects

dragonflow, gnocchi and networking-onos used to be released under a
cycle-independent release model, but they are not part of OpenStack
governance anymore, and development seems to have stopped. Mark them
'release-model: abandoned' so that they show as EOL in releases.o.o.

Change-Id: Idb8500454a72dfcd6f6dd3d8ea360f45045f8754

commit_message:
Add "duration" to task executions printed by CLI commands

* Added "started_at" and "finished_at" to task executions' printout.
* Added "duration" to task executions that's calculated as a delta
  between "finished_at" and "started_at".
* Removed "updated_at" from task executions printout since it doesn't
  carry any relevant info for a user, "finished_at" makes more sense.

Change-Id: Ie0bd01135548bc9fb5137368a1933d7b8b3c11e5

subject: Add an option to pass an existing subnet as VIP IPv6 subnet
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-04 16:46:13.000000000', 'message': "Add an option to pass an existing subnet as VIP IPv6 subnet

IPv6 tests may use an existing subnet 'ipv6-private-subnet' (if it
exists) as the VIP IPv6 subnet.
This commit adds an option to override the default subnet name if
needed. It might be more suitable in a context where a private IPv6
subnet already exists but with a different name (such as TripleO).

Change-Id: I3d98082db3129ce2b2889f70a5cb1e3814ca4da6
"}]
commit_message:
Add an option to pass an existing subnet as VIP IPv6 subnet

IPv6 tests may use an existing subnet 'ipv6-private-subnet' (if it
exists) as the VIP IPv6 subnet.
This commit adds an option to override the default subnet name if
needed. It might be more suitable in a context where a private IPv6
subnet already exists but with a different name (such as TripleO).

Change-Id: I3d98082db3129ce2b2889f70a5cb1e3814ca4da6

Some container execs have an environment, let's make sure they are
included when running exec.

NOTE: This is for Rocky and below as docker was the only supported
method in these versions. Additionally in Rocky and below, the
environment was a list and not a dictionary so we only support a list

Change-Id: Ic2e2c2d50f5883f7db28768ba215e74bcbf9fd8b
(cherry picked from commit b5be45067ac1e7d3b08458e2943e8de046aeee7b)
"}]
commit_message:
builder: include environment when running an exec

Some container execs have an environment, let's make sure they are
included when running exec.

NOTE: This is for Rocky and below as docker was the only supported
method in these versions. Additionally in Rocky and below, the
environment was a list and not a dictionary so we only support a list
version for the environment.

Closes-Bug: #1855932
Change-Id: Ic2e2c2d50f5883f7db28768ba215e74bcbf9fd8b
(cherry picked from commit b5be45067ac1e7d3b08458e2943e8de046aeee7b)

[{'created': '2020-01-20 22:54:50.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Search Path Override

If you follow the docs for developing validations, you will find
you run into an error when attempting to execute your new validation
because the code is currently hard coded to search in a path in
/usr/share where the packaging installs the validations.  For

commit_message:
Adds Search Path Override

If you follow the docs for developing validations, you will find
you run into an error when attempting to execute your new validation
because the code is currently hard coded to search in a path in
/usr/share where the packaging installs the validations.  For
development, you must hack the path in the script to make this work.

This patch adds a simple override where a developer can export
a path to the VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR environment variable and that will
be used as the search path for validations.  Example:

cd tripleo-validations
export VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR=$(pwd)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/
Change-Id: I064c11561af67d284dcf1ab024e0d600e12a8f98

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:19:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix kayobe overcloud provision without seed in limit

If you run 'kayobe overcloud provision' for the first time on a system,
and do not include the seed in the limit (e.g. --limit overcloud), then
the following error is seen:

    Destination directory /etc/kolla/bifrost/inventory/host_vars does
    not exist

This is because the first play in ansible/kolla-bifrost-hostvars.yml
executes against the seed. This is not ideal, as the --limit argment is
useful with this command, as a way to provision specific nodes.

This change fixes the issue by moving the initialisation tasks to the
second play which is targeted at the overcloud group. The run_once
parameter ensures it happens once.

Change-Id: I7dff72a50f0592a3564c9d84d684db562c30626a

commit_message:
Fix kayobe overcloud provision without seed in limit

If you run 'kayobe overcloud provision' for the first time on a system,
and do not include the seed in the limit (e.g. --limit overcloud), then
the following error is seen:

    Destination directory /etc/kolla/bifrost/inventory/host_vars does
    not exist

This is because the first play in ansible/kolla-bifrost-hostvars.yml
executes against the seed. This is not ideal, as the --limit argment is
useful with this command, as a way to provision specific nodes.

This change fixes the issue by moving the initialisation tasks to the
second play which is targeted at the overcloud group. The run_once
parameter ensures it happens once.

Change-Id: I7dff72a50f0592a3564c9d84d684db562c30626a
Story: 2006757
Task: 37247
(cherry picked from commit e0ff12eaef5f8eb00c4f044196bdc5650110dd07)

commit_message:
Revert "[DVR] Add lock during creation of FIP agent gateway port"

This reverts commit 7b81c1bc67d2d85e03b4c96a8c1c558a2f909836.

It isn't needed anymore with new solution with lock "on db level"
which is introduced in follow-up patch.

Change-Id: Ibf15ee1969f902e8a266825934d9ac963353f0a0

commit_message:
Add "duration" to workflow executions printed by CLI commands

* It's convenient to see duration of an execution right away w/o
  having to calculate it ourselves.
* Minor style changes according to the Mistral Coding Guidelines.

Change-Id: Ibfe806d1f1fcebb9ca0459c82daded308677de44

Remove 'no-op-firewall-nova-driver' validator

Firewalls have been removed from nova. No need to keep this around any
longer.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700511/

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 13:29:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use python3 in release-notes-jobs

release-notes-jobs project-template used in stable branches like rocky
uses python2, but it refers to the master branch of the requirements repo
which now supports only python3. As a result build-openstack-releasenotes
job fail. The releasenotes build is always run against the master branch,
so we can use python3 in release-notes-jobs project-template.

release-notes-jobs and release-notes-jobs-python3 are now similar,
but it would be good to keep both as release-notes-jobs is referred
in stable branches in many repositories.

Change-Id: I708b20424a7b044cac3ea589714235fce5fae546
'}]
commit_message:
Use python3 in release-notes-jobs

release-notes-jobs project-template used in stable branches like rocky
uses python2, but it refers to the master branch of the requirements repo
which now supports only python3. As a result build-openstack-releasenotes
job fail. The releasenotes build is always run against the master branch,
so we can use python3 in release-notes-jobs project-template.

release-notes-jobs and release-notes-jobs-python3 are now similar,
but it would be good to keep both as release-notes-jobs is referred
in stable branches in many repositories.

Change-Id: I708b20424a7b044cac3ea589714235fce5fae546

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-14 22:29:44.000000000', 'message': "Ensure there is always at most 1 dvr fip gw port per agent and network

In patch [1] there was introduced simple lock for creation of
DVR agent's floating IP gateway ports for network to avoid races
and creation of duplicated ports for one agent and one network.

This fix from [1] works in simple examples with only one neutron-server,
so it helped e.g. in CI but it wasn't proper fix for production
deployments which are much bigger and have more neutron server api
workers.

So this patch introduces constraint on database level so this works even
across cluster with multiple neutron-server api workers.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673331/

Change-Id: Id55b8a21d6ecf5e029d1ca267b2cbd2ed91cca4c
Closes-Bug: #1830763

So this patch introduces constraint on database level so this works even

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673331/

Change-Id: Id55b8a21d6ecf5e029d1ca267b2cbd2ed91cca4c

so it helped e.g. in CI but it wasn't proper fix for production
deployments which are much bigger and have more neutron server api
workers.

So this patch introduces constraint on database level so this works even
across cluster with multiple neutron-server api workers.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673331/

Change-Id: Id55b8a21d6ecf5e029d1ca267b2cbd2ed91cca4c
Closes-Bug: #1830763

commit_message:
Ensure there is always at most 1 dvr fip gw port per agent and network

In patch [1] there was introduced simple lock for creation of
DVR agent's floating IP gateway ports for network to avoid races
and creation of duplicated ports for one agent and one network.

This fix from [1] works in simple examples with only one neutron-server,
so it helped e.g. in CI but it wasn't proper fix for production
deployments which are much bigger and have more neutron server api
workers.

So this patch introduces constraint on database level so this works even
across cluster with multiple neutron-server api workers.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673331/

Change-Id: Id55b8a21d6ecf5e029d1ca267b2cbd2ed91cca4c
Closes-Bug: #1830763

commit_message:
Add keystone_resources_managed option to the cinder api class

Add the keystone_resources_managed toggle so we can let Ansible
controlling that resource and not Puppet.

It's part of the efforts to not rely on Puppet to create Cloud resources
like keystone resources, cinder types, etc.

Change-Id: I557d8f33c9c699aed14b3b6fc1d1c0407365cd08

commit_message:
Create node lessee field

This spec describes a change to nodes that adds a lessee field,
and exposes it to policy checks. It also updates node list
functions and the allocations conductor.

Change-Id: Ie0b5fa64bfbb45197c11bc65f0e45a8643b9b195
Story: 2006506
Task: 37930

[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:20:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix use of IPA images in Bifrost without a checksum

Ironic now provides DIB-built CentOS images at
https://tarballs.openstack.org/ironic-python-agent/dib/files. However,
if Bifrost is configured to use these, then the 'kayobe seed service
deploy' command fails because the checksum files are not available.

This change fixes the issue by allowing
'kolla_bifrost_ipa_kernel_checksum_url' and
'kolla_bifrost_ipa_ramdisk_checksum_url' to be overridden to empty
strings, indicating that there is no checksum.

Very similar to the issue fixed in https://review.opendev.org/688359 for
the overcloud.

commit_message:
Fix use of IPA images in Bifrost without a checksum

Ironic now provides DIB-built CentOS images at
https://tarballs.openstack.org/ironic-python-agent/dib/files. However,
if Bifrost is configured to use these, then the 'kayobe seed service
deploy' command fails because the checksum files are not available.

This change fixes the issue by allowing
'kolla_bifrost_ipa_kernel_checksum_url' and
'kolla_bifrost_ipa_ramdisk_checksum_url' to be overridden to empty
strings, indicating that there is no checksum.

Very similar to the issue fixed in https://review.opendev.org/688359 for
the overcloud.

Change-Id: If73cebb95c7d0596dc8087112fc19398a113f0cc
Story: 2006715
Task: 37407
(cherry picked from commit 170ebad1dbaff5114873990d53236e2515b1303e)

commit_message:
Add features for add backup id to volume metadata

This feature will support when the backup restore chooses
to create a new volume, record 'src_backup_id' in the
volume metadata.

Change-Id: Ib0b338e8b618f812f1a699e16583b1416d419644

commit_message:
Support verifying the digest for hyperkube image

Given we're using public container registry as the default registry,
so it would be nice to have a verification for the image's digest.
Kubernetes already supports that so user can just use format like
@sha256:xxx for those addons' tags. This patch introduces the support
for hyperkube based on podman and fedora coreos driver.

Task: 37776
Story: 2007001

Change-Id: I970c1b91254d2a375192420a9169f3a629c56ce7
(cherry picked from commit a943756aeab2a6f54485da39be0d986660cd7db0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 12:35:00.000000000', 'message': 'Replace svirt_sandbox_file_t by container_file_t

While they are, at SELinux level, exactly the same (one is an alias to
the other), the "container_file_t" name is easier to understand (and
shorter to write).

A second pass in a couple of days or weeks will be needed in order to
change files that were merged after this first pass.

Change-Id: Ib4b3e65dbaeb5894403301251866b9817240a9d5
'}]
commit_message:
Replace svirt_sandbox_file_t by container_file_t

While they are, at SELinux level, exactly the same (one is an alias to
the other), the "container_file_t" name is easier to understand (and
shorter to write).

A second pass in a couple of days or weeks will be needed in order to
change files that were merged after this first pass.

Change-Id: Ib4b3e65dbaeb5894403301251866b9817240a9d5

commit_message:
Stop running kolla-target-venv in seed hypervisor host upgrade

We don't run kolla-target-venv during `seed hypervisor host configure`.
This playbook is limited to seed:overcloud anyway.

(cherry picked from commit 0b0b921a62f82bbb50bc06dbe05880e57d364028)

messages:
[{'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-06-24 15:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-06-24 15:24:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-06-25 12:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-06-28 07:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2019-06-28 11:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

LGTM, thanks for this feature'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-07-04 15:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2019-07-06 11:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2019-07-06 11:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can you add a releasenotes and edit the documentation according to your change ?'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-11-28 07:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-11-28 10:00:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-11-28 13:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-11-28 13:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-11-28 14:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

IMO you also need to check if image is present or not before each import as discussed and mentioned in the specs https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669201/13/specs/ussuri/approved/glance/import-multi-stores.rst@76'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-11-28 17:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> IMO you also need to check if image is present or not before each
 > import as discussed and mentioned in the specs https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669201/13/specs/ussuri/approved/glance/import-multi-stores.rst@76

Yes sure I will add it. I just wanted to add the new "stores" parameter in this patch to allow you to work with this field on your POC. I couldn't afford to attend today glance meeting to discuss about this.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-11-29 05:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Hi Gregoire,

I know this is in WIP, still given some nits.
Also allow_failure is missing (or still in progress).'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-11-29 08:34:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Hi Abhishek,

Thanks for the review, I'll continue the implementation with your comments in mind."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-12-01 12:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-12-01 13:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Hi Greg,

Thanks for the work on this, I truly appreciate your help.

I'm not convinced 'though that the set_data is actually the right place to handle the multiple uploads. I really would prefer doing this in taskflow so we have better control and understanding what's going on. With taskflow at least we have the tasks API to debug and monitor the node. If we put all this multiple stores logic into the set_data, we quickly end up with black box running hours and no-one having any idea what it is doing.

Fortunately it would not be wasting much of the work you have done, we'd just move the logic into the construct of that taskflow and add multiple upload to store tasks based on the store list. This also gives us better control of the error scenarios and how we want to recover or fail from them.

I also added an idea of utilizing some reserved properties to indicate the progress into Abhishek's copy spec comments. Let me know what do you think."}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-02 08:59:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hello Erno,

This seems like a good idea, It'll be easier to handle allow_failure parameter in this case using the revert method of _ImportToStore task.
I've made some refactoring as asked by Abhishek, I'll upload it with this new implementation."}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-02 16:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-02 16:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

First version with "allow_failure" and taskflow modified.
Early push to have feedback to ensure I'm going in right direction.
Still need to add some tests and make extensive tests on a lab.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-03 05:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)

Hi Gregoire,

Looks like on right track, added some nits. I guess you need to implement os_glance_failed_imports and os_glance_successful_imports logic along with deletion check before each import starts.

Also need to send notification as well.

Thank you for your work!!!'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-03 05:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-03 07:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 13:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(4 comments)

Hi Abhishek,

Thanks for your review.
I have to work too on the way I pass the status of the image to active.'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 16:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:13:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> (1 comment)

Hello, the spec was changed and you can't anymore specify a comma delimited list in the header 'x-image-meta-store'. You have to use the new parameter "stores" in the payload request.
Patches 4/5 work with this old behavior.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30054, 'date': '2019-12-03 21:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-04 03:11:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> (1 comment)

You are right, it was working perfectly in my copying image case, I haven't tested imports with it. Yes there is no other way in this case."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-04 03:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-12-04 05:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Pending work:

1. Check image is deleted or not in each import task

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-24 15:23:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to import image into multi-stores

The header 'x-image-meta-store' can now handle a list of backends
separated by comma (example: "ceph_fast,ceph_cheap").
During import stage, Glance iterates overs this list and send the data
to each store one by one.
If an invalid backend is requested by the user, an exception is raised.
If an errors occurs during verify, already pushed data is removed and
image state is unchanged.

Change-Id: Id3ac19488c0a693d7042be4a3c83f3b9f12313d0
Implements: import-multi-stores

commit_message:
Add ability to import image into multi-stores

The import image api now supports a list of stores to import data into.
This list can be specified through a new "stores" field that has been
added to the request body.
During import stage, Glance iterates overs this list and send the data
to each store one by one.
If an invalid backend is requested by the user, an exception is raised.
If an errors occurs during verify, already pushed data is removed and
image state is unchanged.

Change-Id: Id3ac19488c0a693d7042be4a3c83f3b9f12313d0
Implements: blueprint import-multi-stores

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-05 09:08:15.000000000', 'message': 'Set the delayed call "key" field to the right value

* The field "key" of the DelayedCall class must be set to the right
  value. It allows to significantly optimize performance of workflows
  with "join" tasks. However, it was broken during the refactoring
  in the summer of 2019. This patch fixes it.
* Added another profiler trace decorator.

Change-Id: I247b674d8a358795871cfa87bcdf29f4857ca2d8
'}, {'created': '2020-02-05 09:09:01.000000000', 'message': 'Set the delayed call "key" field to the right value

* The field "key" of the DelayedCall class must be set to the right
  value. It allows to significantly optimize performance of workflows
  with "join" tasks. However, it was broken during the refactoring
  in the summer of 2019. This patch fixes it.
* Added another profiler trace decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1861988

commit_message:
Set the delayed call "key" field to the right value

* The field "key" of the DelayedCall class must be set to the right
  value. It allows to significantly optimize performance of workflows
  with "join" tasks. However, it was broken during the refactoring
  in the summer of 2019. This patch fixes it.
* Added another profiler trace decorator.

Cherry-picked from 5b5576dd04ac596b619ee61e0aa837effd319c49

Closes-Bug: #1861988
Change-Id: I247b674d8a358795871cfa87bcdf29f4857ca2d8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 15:21:59.000000000', 'message': 'placement client: fix routed prov networks working

Routed provider networks works with placement microversion 1.1, that
version returned no body for resource provider creation, but from 1.20
body is returned and the client expected that as bandwidth feature were
designed after that.

Related-Bug: #1828543
Change-Id: Id6e6d633b00237d8909160e7ed6f5e495399a252
'}]
commit_message:
placement client: fix routed prov networks working

Routed provider networks works with placement microversion 1.1, that
version returned no body for resource provider creation, but from 1.20
body is returned and the client expected that as bandwidth feature were
designed after that.

Related-Bug: #1828543
Change-Id: Id6e6d633b00237d8909160e7ed6f5e495399a252

subject: Provide a clear error message when using client.Client without a session
messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-02-10 10:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-10 10:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-02-10 12:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-02-10 12:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 1220d7685723b8235135d2d02c11008c7f7fb18a'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 10:07:14.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a clear error message when using client.Client without a session

Currently we fail with _construct_http_client() takes at least 1 argument.
This change provides a proper TypeError and updates documentation to make
it clear where a session is required. Also provided are explicit unit
tests on passing a session via various means.

Change-Id: I96073dc80d225a9b88fdc12bb058c0145aca623b
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a clear error message when using client.Client without a session

Currently we fail with _construct_http_client() takes at least 1 argument.
This change provides a proper TypeError and updates documentation to make
it clear where a session is required. Also provided are explicit unit
tests on passing a session via various means.

Change-Id: I96073dc80d225a9b88fdc12bb058c0145aca623b

commit_message:
Add extra filesystem support

Tinycore needs xfs support in order to be used in certian
low memory testing situtions with images that prefer
to use XFS as the filesystem.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 09:17:51.000000000', 'message': "Create /var/lib/config-data if it doesn't exist.

When performing the Undercloud upgrade from OSP13
to OSP16, we start from an almost empty Undercloud
node which has been upgraded to RHEL8 via Leapp.
The /var/lib/config-data is being lost during the
upgrade procedure, so this task makes sure that the
folder exists before checking the selinux state.

Change-Id: I760a4e532e0c299efcf57cee68e8e8f93795ea29
"}]
commit_message:
Create /var/lib/config-data if it doesn't exist.

When performing the Undercloud upgrade from OSP13
to OSP16, we start from an almost empty Undercloud
node which has been upgraded to RHEL8 via Leapp.
The /var/lib/config-data is being lost during the
upgrade procedure, so this task makes sure that the
folder exists before checking the selinux state.

Change-Id: I760a4e532e0c299efcf57cee68e8e8f93795ea29

commit_message:
Don't fail the unit tests if a client isn't installed

The Python clients should be considered optional. This is why we don't
error when importing them. This changes the test_generator test to be
tollerant of clients that are not installed.

This can happen in a couple of situations;
- we don't want to fail if one client is bad and doesn't install correctly.
- Alternatively when packaged by downstream consumers (such as the RDO rpms)
  not all OpenStack clients are packaged. they will then be missing but the
  package building process still uses the tests for verification.

Needed-By: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/14216/
Change-Id: Ie9897c612ec16985ecd0b1c2ee0b058a8df781d9

commit_message:
Notify router_update after directly gateway IP change

If directly change router gateway port IP address, the gateway IP
does not changed in router related namespace in l3 agent side. This
patch adds a method to catch a 'PORT' IP change event, and notify
the L3 agent.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py

commit_message:
Notify router_update after directly gateway IP change

If directly change router gateway port IP address, the gateway IP
does not changed in router related namespace in l3 agent side. This
patch adds a method to catch a 'PORT' IP change event, and notify
the L3 agent.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py

Closes-Bug: #1795222
Change-Id: If276a7613c156f8c826967c9c8cbd6f2a8d32674
(cherry picked from commit 8c17df7138744de567d1e45cfb604a0221db90ab)

commit_message:
Remove L3 IP QoS cache when router is down

When router admin-state is down or removed, fip-qos and gateway-ip-qos
extension should delete the router IPs' QoS rate limit cache. Then if
the router is up again the router floating IPs QoS can be reconfigured.
This patch achives these:
1. make sure floating IP or gateway IP QoS cache removed.
2. floating IP QoS can be re-configured to snat device when router
   doing admin_state down/up.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/extensions/qos/fip.py
    neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/extensions/qos/test_gateway_ip.py

Closes-Bug: #1826695
Change-Id: I24fcecd9686ad17fa50093bb8bccab0d6c711298
(cherry picked from commit 78629e0d3780af4a8a8cc1b5b0762e0bc8a48f1f)

commit_message:
Split fs20 periodic tempest - api* in fs1 scenario* in fs20

We want to reduce tests in fs20 for stability and runtime.
Tracked by tripleo-ci squad in [1]. Testing in [2].
Depends-On bumps fs1 timeout to 5hrs.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1383
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/24339/
Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/24781
Change-Id: I9c434b7a907f02aee712bebe532abcae1a948320

commit_message:
Add manila tempest testing

This patch adds definiton of manila extra configuration, which should be used
for correct work of tempest and running manila test.
Additionally it sets default manila backend to cephfs and extends scenario

Change-Id: I636bf2fee1833d33d66c4f2812f2d510cabd15d6

commit_message:
Modernize docs build process.

- Stop calling 'build_sphinx'. This requires the use of
  sphinxcontrib-apidoc to continue building API docs.
- Use a newer version of openstackdocstheme since it auto-configures
  stuff for us.
- Move docs requirements to a separate file.

Change-Id: Icc42bab02840841bdd55b2a1666007be7fcabc10
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Exclude sova patterns changes from tripleo jobs

For fast merging of patterns file let's exclude it from usual
tripleo jobs. It will allow us to merge required patterns ASAP
even if tripleo gates are broken.
Patterns are still checked and tested with molecule jobs so we
are covered.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/
Change-Id: Ic2840b12c800130a9be5139032f4b479b39795fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 09:35:11.000000000', 'message': '[Queens-only] make sure cellv2 host discovery task only run once

The discovery task is correct triggered via delegate only on a single node,
but all computes delegate the job to this single host. It is possible that
this rund multiple times in parallel and fails as nova-manage commands are
not meant to run multiple times at the same time.

This makes sure the task only gets triggered once.

Change-Id: I072baf357836c55ad37257158b83f25c16b7f46f
Closes-Bug: #1862321
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens-only] make sure cellv2 host discovery task only run once

The discovery task is correct triggered via delegate only on a single node,
but all computes delegate the job to this single host. It is possible that
this rund multiple times in parallel and fails as nova-manage commands are
not meant to run multiple times at the same time.

This makes sure the task only gets triggered once.

Change-Id: I072baf357836c55ad37257158b83f25c16b7f46f
Closes-Bug: #1862321

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

telemetry-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I72abc58ee67cf0594faa07e0f89b52f1c9cc6c2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 10:55:46.000000000', 'message': 'Minimizing L3 agent QoS extensions lock granularity

If agent is concurrently processing large set of resources,
the bottleneck lock will multiply increase processing time
of those resources which have been waiting for the lock for
a long time.

This patch moves the lock to the core cache resource, and
leverage the coordination lock to the resource prcessing
and notification thread functions.

Closes-Bug: #1824911
Change-Id: Id43829b11631727f1a46362ffea5c22d2177fd79
(cherry picked from commit ab57410ec8e5fae97dec052a5940debd614e4e50)
'}]
commit_message:
Minimizing L3 agent QoS extensions lock granularity

If agent is concurrently processing large set of resources,
the bottleneck lock will multiply increase processing time
of those resources which have been waiting for the lock for
a long time.

This patch moves the lock to the core cache resource, and
leverage the coordination lock to the resource prcessing
and notification thread functions.

Closes-Bug: #1824911
Change-Id: Id43829b11631727f1a46362ffea5c22d2177fd79
(cherry picked from commit ab57410ec8e5fae97dec052a5940debd614e4e50)

[{'created': '2019-07-09 09:52:55.000000000', 'message': "Creates and Reorders the Boot Entry

In case of large UEFI systems, when we provision wholedisk images using
boot-option as local, OS deoesn't boot as the boot entry is not present.
So using efibootmgr command we can create the boot entry and reorder
so that OS will boot after we provision the wholedisk images.

commit_message:
Creates and Reorders the Boot Entry

In case of large UEFI systems, when we provision wholedisk images using
boot-option as local, OS does not boot as the boot entry is not present.
So using efibootmgr command we can create the boot entry for the disk
where image has been written.

Depends-On: I3a5c9337424649f4250af008a101a4a6437ae5cc
Change-Id: I02a1c033d2fa1fdf063594efc7977cfdbe05fb6a
Story: 2005533
Task: 35724

commit_message:
Add power management command

$ suchycli power \
    --username jelly --password fish \
    --service-endpoint http://fish.me \
    --system-id /redfish/v1/Systems/1 \
    on

Story: 2006608
Task: 36776
Change-Id: I929b91a43f91c5b9cac5c24f9e1a7ccf55f2a789

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 12:12:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove L3 IP QoS cache when router is down

When router admin-state is down or removed, fip-qos and gateway-ip-qos
extension should delete the router IPs' QoS rate limit cache. Then if
the router is up again the router floating IPs QoS can be reconfigured.
This patch achives these:
1. make sure floating IP or gateway IP QoS cache removed.
2. floating IP QoS can be re-configured to snat device when router
   doing admin_state down/up.

Closes-Bug: #1826695
Change-Id: I24fcecd9686ad17fa50093bb8bccab0d6c711298
(cherry picked from commit 78629e0d3780af4a8a8cc1b5b0762e0bc8a48f1f)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove L3 IP QoS cache when router is down

When router admin-state is down or removed, fip-qos and gateway-ip-qos
extension should delete the router IPs' QoS rate limit cache. Then if
the router is up again the router floating IPs QoS can be reconfigured.
This patch achives these:
1. make sure floating IP or gateway IP QoS cache removed.
2. floating IP QoS can be re-configured to snat device when router
   doing admin_state down/up.

Closes-Bug: #1826695
Change-Id: I24fcecd9686ad17fa50093bb8bccab0d6c711298
(cherry picked from commit 78629e0d3780af4a8a8cc1b5b0762e0bc8a48f1f)

'}, {'created': '2019-05-09 01:15:56.000000000', 'message': "Minimizing L3 agent QoS extensions lock granularity

If agent is concurrently processing large set of resources,
the bottleneck lock will multiply increase processing time
of those resources which have been waiting for the lock for
a long time.

Add a generic coordination lock mechanism for various
scenarios. This decorator allows flexible lock name
with parameters and names of underlying functions.
For instance:
    @synchronized('{f_name}-{resource.id}-{snap[name]}')
    def foo(self, resource, snap):

This patch moves the lock to the core cache resource, and
leverage the new coordination lock to the resource prcessing
and notification thread functions.

Closes-Bug: #1824911
Change-Id: Id43829b11631727f1a46362ffea5c22d2177fd79

commit_message:
Minimizing L3 agent QoS extensions lock granularity

If agent is concurrently processing large set of resources,
the bottleneck lock will multiply increase processing time
of those resources which have been waiting for the lock for
a long time.

This patch moves the lock to the core cache resource, and
leverage the coordination lock to the resource prcessing
and notification thread functions.

Closes-Bug: #1824911
Change-Id: Id43829b11631727f1a46362ffea5c22d2177fd79

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 20:48:58.000000000', 'message': "Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Using tox 'all' env to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

commit_message:
Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Using tox 'all' env to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

commit_message:
Remove unused legacy playbooks

Legacy jobs except grenade job has been migrated
to zuulv3 in - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/644586

But legacy playbooks has been left to remove. Those are
unused now and can be removed from master and train branch.

Change-Id: I1f432c8c99d6a7e695d00baddb9aab795d8685bb
(cherry picked from commit 911f372bbe4f15f295235e17bf4f7f372bc1a62e)

[{'created': '2020-02-09 10:24:08.000000000', 'message': "Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Using tox 'all' env to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

commit_message:
Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Enable designate-tempest-plugin and using tox 'all' env
to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

[{'created': '2020-01-31 12:04:30.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Modify DVR flows to allow ARP requests to hit ARP Responder table

DVR does the ARP table update through the control plane, and does not
allow any ARP requests to get out of the node.

In order to address the allowed address pair VRRP IP issue with DVR,
we need to add an ARP entry into the ARP Responder table for the
allowed address pair IP ( which is taken care by the patch in [1])

This patch adds a rule in the br-int to redirect the packet
destinated to the router to the actual router-port and also moves
the arp filtering rule to the tunnel or the physical port based on the
configuration.

By adding the above rule it allows the ARP requests to reach the
ARP Responder table and filters the ARP requests before it reaches
the physical network or the tunnel.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601336/

commit_message:
DVR: Modify DVR flows to allow ARP requests to hit ARP Responder table

DVR does the ARP table update through the control plane, and does not
allow any ARP requests to get out of the node.

In order to address the allowed address pair VRRP IP issue with DVR,
we need to add an ARP entry into the ARP Responder table for the
allowed address pair IP ( which is taken care by the patch in [1])

This patch adds a rule in the br-int to redirect the packet
destinated to the router to the actual router-port and also moves
the arp filtering rule to the tunnel or the physical port based on the
configuration.

By adding the above rule it allows the ARP requests to reach the
ARP Responder table and filters the ARP requests before it reaches
the physical network or the tunnel.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601336/
Related-Bug: #1774459

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/ovs_bridge_test_base.py

Change-Id: I3905ea56ca0ff35bdd96c818719e6d63a3eb5a72
(cherry picked from commit 52b537ca22b2d7d81a84b2f75de577d8dffee94c)
(cherry picked from commit 09c4e0e970b02ed992aab762505d17f1decca551)
(cherry picked from commit de5d687e4ae983ec2d9f974ede792812d0f95aff)

commit_message:
DVR: Modify DVR flows to allow ARP requests to hit ARP Responder table

DVR does the ARP table update through the control plane, and does not
allow any ARP requests to get out of the node.

In order to address the allowed address pair VRRP IP issue with DVR,
we need to add an ARP entry into the ARP Responder table for the
allowed address pair IP ( which is taken care by the patch in [1])

This patch adds a rule in the br-int to redirect the packet
destinated to the router to the actual router-port and also moves
the arp filtering rule to the tunnel or the physical port based on the
configuration.

By adding the above rule it allows the ARP requests to reach the
ARP Responder table and filters the ARP requests before it reaches
the physical network or the tunnel.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/601336/
Related-Bug: #1774459

Conflicts:
    .zuul.yaml
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/br_dvr_process.py

commit_message:
Don't use defined

The 'defined' function is always true for defined variables
even when the value is undef. This makes the conditionals useless
and this patch makes the module to test value instead.

Change-Id: I9228d84e02b485f089fce84ea12ca8afba903a61

So we need to find a solution to install the devstack-tempest-plugin into the tempest all environment. Not sure what grenade does differently than the plain tempest job.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-07 13:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> So we need to find a solution to install the devstack-tempest-plugin
 > into the tempest all environment. Not sure what grenade does
 > differently than the plain tempest job.

desginate-tempest-plugin is installed by devstack as it is enabled in job but grenade still run the tempest smoke tests on old node to verify the installation and that is why it fail because old node (stable/stein in this case) need tempest fix.

Once we get this series in then, it will be fixes from rocky - > stein->train. To get all merge we need to merge the fixes in reverse way like stable/stein first and then train.
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:fix-stable-gate+(status:open+OR+status:merged)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2020-02-09 08:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 20:49:13.000000000', 'message': "Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Using tox 'all' env to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

commit_message:
Use Tempest 'all' tox env

Tempest recently moved tox default
to py3 including all-plugin env.
-https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703011/

This will fail the py2 jobs which are using
all-plugin tox env. Because tox all-plugin
env var enable the sitepackages=True. Py2 jobs
install the tempest plugins on py2 and all-plugin
tox try to find the installed plugins on py3 which
cause no test to run and fail the job.

tox all-plugin has been deprecated since long and not
supposed to use for plugins who already in migrated to
separate repo in queens cycle.

Using tox 'all' env to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Ib1a2be90c0b3dbacc6daf52f0fc6f326ab47fc98
Closes-Bug: 1862240

commit_message:
When upgrading overcloud, separate configs

For each upgrade prepare step X, execute only tasks matching its
dedicated config_id: tripleo_upgradeX. The upgrade converge & upgrade
run will use the default tripleo_stepX config ids.

This provides separation of deployment and upgrade tasks defined for
Day1 and Day2 cases via the common framework

Change-Id: I17bed8c6dd8cc272fbe33b99b249f19baee6dc59
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

for tasks separation.

commit_message:
Support cross-tenant metrics in monasca collector

This allows metrics to be fetched from the current scope in the monasca
collector, in case cross-metric tenant submission is enabled: https://github.com/openstack/monasca-agent/blob/master/docs/MonascaMetrics.md#cross-tenant-metric-submission.

Story: 2006696
Task: 36999
Change-Id: Icd32a2d0be249efea0867d8a2966c156084e75bb

commit_message:
Updated tempest skip list for stein

Currently scenario 1 and 4 standalone stable/stein check and gate
job is broken due to volume encryption and swift related tempest
tests failure.

In order to unblock the gates, we are currently moving tests to
skip list.

Related-Bug: #1862143
Related-Bug: #1862142

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706196/

Change-Id: Ieabc0d56e01ced15860da5642c9d62c620e9c0db
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix InfluxDB storage's "_point_to_dataframe_entry" method

This fixes the "_point_to_dataframe_entry" method by checking if the
"metadata" and "groupby" attributes of points returned by the influxdb
client are not None.

Change-Id: Ic7e482fad3ad05026fa14412acb577fe7a02045c
(cherry picked from commit 0259fe458cc0c145231b9690e4d54e60116fd9b7)

commit_message:
add handling for multiple error returns

This change adds logic to the `exceptions.from_response` to handle
errors formatted in accordance with the API-SIG guidelines. When there
are multiple errors returned, only the first error will be included in
the exception with a note informing that there were more errors.

API SIG guideline:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-sig/guidelines/errors.html

email thread for content:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006377.html

related neutron bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1828543

Change-Id: I1f06c2cd5c4e93e04582d4ffbb434db92010d712

commit_message:
Close db connection in mysql check

Mysql log gets an "Aborted connection" warning every 30sec
because the connection is not being closed properly.

Story: 2007233
Task: 38509
Change-Id: Ied6c19f8f7ac9b81f61b84efa2f6c7a8e40c3056

[{'created': '2020-02-10 08:07:05.000000000', 'message': "Mock Zun fake client method

* The Zun client doesn't have an rpm packaging so
running the unit test might fail if not installed.

* The Designate client was fixed so there is no need to mock it.

* Use Mock Fixture instead of calling directly the mock.patch,object

Change-Id: Id7226c889c18dbe3a38b106b0cdac5e331f54e3a
"}]
commit_message:
Mock Zun fake client method

* The Zun client doesn't have an rpm packaging so
running the unit test might fail if not installed.

* The Designate client was fixed so there is no need to mock it.

* Use Mock Fixture instead of calling directly the mock.patch,object

Change-Id: Id7226c889c18dbe3a38b106b0cdac5e331f54e3a

Add RadosGW gate

commit_message:
aarch64: enable influxdb and telegraf for Debian/Ubuntu

Turns out that upstream provides repos also for aarch64.

CentOS one is not usable due to wrong arch name used (arm64 instead of
aarch64).

Change-Id: I1b4ef1fae0914d6826af5456cc9ea53bb26972ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-26 10:14:36.000000000', 'message': "Set Tempest's service_availability setting for panko

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].panko is true then, panko test will run
or if [service_availability].panko is false then, all panko related tests either
in telemetry tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

This commit add the setting of panko service[1] on panko devstack plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://github.com/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin/blob/master/telemetry_tempest_plugin/config.py#L23

Change-Id: I57e182850fbf7fcab5df75c05f0ef95a8c23e923
"}, {'created': '2020-01-06 03:53:46.000000000', 'message': "Set Tempest's service_availability setting for panko

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].panko is true then, panko test will run
or if [service_availability].panko is false then, all panko related tests either
in telemetry tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

This commit add the setting of panko service[1] on panko devstack plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://github.com/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin/blob/master/telemetry_tempest_plugin/config.py#L23

Change-Id: I57e182850fbf7fcab5df75c05f0ef95a8c23e923
"}]
commit_message:
Set Tempest's service_availability setting for panko

Tempest's service_availability config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_availability].panko is true then, panko test will run
or if [service_availability].panko is false then, all panko related tests either
in telemetry tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

This commit add the setting of panko service[1] on panko devstack plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://github.com/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin/blob/master/telemetry_tempest_plugin/config.py#L23

Change-Id: I57e182850fbf7fcab5df75c05f0ef95a8c23e923

commit_message:
Add note for loadbalancer resource type support

This adds a release note for the loadbalancer resource type change
Ib6e78438c3da0e22d93f720f00cdeadf0ed7a91f which was backported to stable
branches.

[{'created': '2020-01-23 17:29:45.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

murano-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I4abb7e97583103ce17e7101cb9dfb824eea397a0
'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

murano-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I4abb7e97583103ce17e7101cb9dfb824eea397a0

commit_message:
Fix ipxe interface to perform ipxe boot without ipxe_enabled enabled

When ipxe hardware interface is in use, the node should always be boot
with iPXE disregards the deprecated configuration option [pxe]ipxe_enabled.

Story: 2007003
Task: 37779

Change-Id: Ia658ddc966e13a7ce973eccd9c42e40a3da406f4

'}, {'created': '2018-09-14 06:18:53.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add in security annotation

This patch set adds in apparmor security annotations to Deployment
and Daemonset manifests for the following components: keystone,
heat, neutron, cinder, glance, nova and horizon.

It also demostrates how a custom profile can be delivered to the
OpenStack components, by setting up a OpenStack gate test.

Co-Authored-By: Cliff Parsons <cliff.parsons@att.com>
Depends-On: Ib0ca04e8b8527194778afb8053046797abdfdb98

'}, {'created': '2018-10-01 21:38:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add apparmor security annotation

This patch set adds in apparmor security annotations to Deployment
and Daemonset manifests for the following components: keystone,
heat, neutron, cinder, glance, nova and horizon.

It also demostrates how a custom profile can be delivered to the
OpenStack components, by enhancing of of the OpenStack gate tests
(openstack-helm-dev-deploy-nfs-ovs) to define a customized AppArmor
profile and load it on some of the OpenStack component pods, and then
verify that the custom profile is active on those pods.

Co-Authored-By: Cliff Parsons <cliff.parsons@att.com>
Depends-On: Ib0ca04e8b8527194778afb8053046797abdfdb98
Change-Id: I905cb38caf0c3bcf2d55d59f13b4efb7c61a4331
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-02 00:12:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add apparmor security annotation

This patch set adds in apparmor security annotations to Deployment
and Daemonset manifests for the following components: keystone,
heat, neutron, cinder, glance, nova and horizon.

It also demostrates how a custom profile can be delivered to the
OpenStack components, by enhancing of of the OpenStack gate tests
(openstack-helm-dev-deploy-nfs-ovs) to define a customized AppArmor
profile and load it on some of the OpenStack component pods, and then
verify that the custom profile is active on those pods.

commit_message:
Add apparmor security annotation

This patch set adds in apparmor security annotations to Deployment
and Daemonset manifests for the following components: keystone,
heat, cinder, glance, and horizon.

Change-Id: I905cb38caf0c3bcf2d55d59f13b4efb7c61a4331
Co-Authored-By: Cliff Parsons <cliff.parsons@att.com>
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

Looks great, couple thoughts'}, {'account_id': 26086, 'date': '2018-04-11 15:46:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

Just nit-picking a bit on the design here. I get the concept of having the sidecar be a uniform approach for services that don't to native TLS (or do it poorly) but wouldn't it be more efficient, since you are already adding the sidecar container to just use uwsgi to run the APIs and have nginx talk to uwsgi through a unix domain socket ?

Upstream is already pushing most services to be uwsgi compliant with glance probably the one most notable exception. Shouldn't we try to benefit from that work?"}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-04-11 18:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-04-11 18:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

@Chris @Matt: Updated to use python instead of bash in latest patch.

@Matt: I can move it a new configmap, but would like feedback from other cores to see if we want a new configmap vs. using existing.

@Cristian: Thanks for the feedback.  This design will likely change in the future to do more than just a simple passthrough proxy (like using socket as you suggested).  The main issue is that we officially support newton and ocata and different images (kolla and loci, e.g.) that the decision is to put in something that would work at a base level for most configurations and change this overtime vs. having something advanced that will break specific configurations due to versions or image choice.'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-04-11 22:57:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

Thanks Tin.  Agree on getting additional feedback before making any changes to the configmap approach.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-04-11 23:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Published edit on patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-04-12 07:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-04-13 04:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-04-13 04:22:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

> Just nit-picking a bit on the design here. I get the concept of
 > having the sidecar be a uniform approach for services that don't to
 > native TLS (or do it poorly) but wouldn't it be more efficient,
 > since you are already adding the sidecar container to just use
 > uwsgi to run the APIs and have nginx talk to uwsgi through a unix
 > domain socket ?
 > 
 > Upstream is already pushing most services to be uwsgi compliant
 > with glance probably the one most notable exception. Shouldn't we
 > try to benefit from that work?

I 100% agree, and this is certainly where we should be going - though as Tin points out we are somewhat constrained by out mission to support multiple image sources (kolla lacks uwsgi). In a follow on PS I want to move to the socket where possible, and disable this feature when required for kolla support."}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-04-13 04:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-10 13:21:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)

Change-Id: I1a1bd69ef048ba3ccd0b8188742b9bbbc07f3bbc
'}, {'created': '2020-02-02 11:44:01.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

specs repo either has py27 job or requirement or tox env.

Update requirements for Sphinx that works with python3, this needs
updating from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme as well.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I1a1bd69ef048ba3ccd0b8188742b9bbbc07f3bbc
'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

specs repo either has py27 job or requirement or tox env.

Update requirements for Sphinx that works with python3, this needs
updating from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme as well.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I1a1bd69ef048ba3ccd0b8188742b9bbbc07f3bbc

commit_message:
Ensure python versions

It looks like better to specify basepython for all tox envs.
As of the rocky release, we used python 2.7 by default,
so this commit adds python 2.7 for tox envs which have no default python.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/010957.html

Change-Id: I586d1f63039b71f2ec757b06eb32a30a52705568

commit_message:
Ensure python versions

It looks like better to specify basepython for all tox envs.
As of the queens release, we use python 2.7 by default.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/010957.html

Change-Id: I586d1f63039b71f2ec757b06eb32a30a52705568

commit_message:
[OVN] Update QoS related code from networking-ovn

In terms of [1], patch [0] has import the lasted code of ovn_client.py, but not
"/networking_ovn/ml2/qos_driver.py", so this patch will update it.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697316/
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692084/

Change-Id: Iefff6cdf070d234c4ea9c8e1d5fdfe4542eb7fa3
Closes-Bug: #1813551

split out the quota logic into it's own feature set, so we can eventually extract it into a plugin repo of it's own."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-09-27 02:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-09-27 02:47:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

in a more real environment this appears to cause circular import issues.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-10-04 00:17:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Circular import problem... seemed to just 'go away' and I assume it was actually some underlying library issue."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-10-04 00:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-10-04 00:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-10-06 22:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2019-10-22 20:31:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

I really like this new approach.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-10-23 01:04:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I really like this new approach.

Good to know!

I've been wanting to do something nicer for a while, but this became a requirement for example config generation, because otherwise the app had no idea which additional plugins were included, since that used to come from... a config value. This refactor was needed to break that catch 22."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-10-24 01:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2019-12-04 01:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-04 00:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-05 06:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 30447, 'date': '2020-02-09 22:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-10 00:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Refactor the plugin layer to use entrypoints

Introduce the concept of a feature set, which can be
registered to an entrypoint.

Rework all existing core elements into a 'core' feature
set.

Remove the ability to add in random django apps, and drop
the ablity for plugins to optionally be able to great
new DB models.

Change-Id: Idc5c3bf3facc44bb615fa4006d417d6f48a16ddc

subject: Rework Adjutant's config system to use CONFspirator

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-09 07:12:38.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Rework Adjutant's config system

Introduce an incode config system based on oslo.config
but compatible with yaml and envvars for config with
nested groups and namespaces. This has been implemented
in such a way that we can extract it into an external library fairly
easily.

TODO:
- dynamic config registering for tasks, action, notification_engines,
  and delegate_apis
- config for quotas
- documentation

Change-Id: I1d97d72d06b3a3a5df90355d3a4b4fe414381424

"}, {'created': '2019-09-13 06:14:52.000000000', 'message': "Rework Adjutant's config system to use CONFspirator

CONFspirator was written to just specifically for Adjutant
and it allows us to do oslo.config style config management
and definition with nested groups and for yaml.

This is a major change that touches vast amounts of the
code simply because of how much the config touches.

Actions, Tasks, DelegateAPIs, and Notification Handlers
now can define config in their own class and this will
be added to the config.

All the other config is located in `adjutant.config`,
with everything now registed nicely on the config tree,
and grouped in much saner ways.

CONFspirator will also now allow Adjutant to be entirely
configured via environment variables.

We have removed `modify_dict_settings` because that is
now entirely handled by CONFspirator's test utils.

`NotificationEngine`s are now `NotificationHandler`s.

`test_settings.py` is gone! And we now have better ways
to define test settings and defaults.

Project line length bumped to 88, and bugbear added to enforce
that instead.

Story: 2004488

Change-Id: I1d97d72d06b3a3a5df90355d3a4b4fe414381424

and definition with nested groups and for yaml.

This is a major change that touches vast amounts of the
code simply because of how much the config touches.

Actions, Tasks, DelegateAPIs, and Notification Handlers
now can define config in their own class and this will
be added to the config.

All the other config is located in `adjutant.config`,
with everything now registed nicely on the config tree,
and grouped in much saner ways.

CONFspirator will also now allow Adjutant to be entirely
configured via environment variables.

We have removed `modify_dict_settings` because that is
now entirely handled by CONFspirator's test utils.

`NotificationEngine`s are now `NotificationHandler`s.

`test_settings.py` is gone! And we now have better ways
to define test settings and defaults.

Project line length bumped to 88, and bugbear added to enforce
that instead.

Story: 2004488

Change-Id: I1d97d72d06b3a3a5df90355d3a4b4fe414381424

commit_message:
Rework Adjutant's config system to use CONFspirator

CONFspirator was written to just specifically for Adjutant
and it allows us to do oslo.config style config management
and definition with nested groups and for yaml.

This is a major change that touches vast amounts of the
code simply because of how much the config touches.

Actions, Tasks, DelegateAPIs, and Notification Handlers
now can define config in their own class and this will
be added to the config.

All the other config is located in `adjutant.config`,
with everything now registed nicely on the config tree,
and grouped in much saner ways.

CONFspirator will also now allow Adjutant to be entirely
configured via environment variables.

We have removed `modify_dict_settings` because that is
now entirely handled by CONFspirator's test utils.

`NotificationEngine`s are now `NotificationHandler`s.

`test_settings.py` is gone! And we now have better ways
to define test settings and defaults.

Project line length bumped to 88, and bugbear added to enforce
that instead.

Story: 2004488

Change-Id: I1d97d72d06b3a3a5df90355d3a4b4fe414381424
